description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As Head of Gamer Support, you will support products and customers in a fast-paced environment. You will develop support strategy, policies, and infrastructure and work with Product and Operations teams to understand feature roadmaps and communicate those to the partners assisting to support our customers. Additionally, you will serve as a liaison between specific product teams and the broader Consumer Operations team in Google Hardware.

Support team members are usually the first and second points of contact to resolve technical challenges with products for our customers. We are product experts who understand the top issues that users are facing. We build lively, high-quality, online and real-world communities to ensure user engagement, and are well-versed in social media and online community trends, technology, and strategies.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in customer support, account management, or community management in the games industry.
  • Experience in vendor management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in people management, growing the careers and skill sets of direct reports.
  • Experience as a gamer.
  • Understanding of wide range of tools and processes that can be used to improve operational efficiency and workflow.
  • Ability to simultaneously lead and manage multiple projects with a broad range of internal and external constituents.
  • Excellent technical and analytical skills.
  • Excellent organizational, influencing, and presentation skills.
responsibilities:
• Build the policies and processes that will support customers and implement and support tools, processes, and systems to support user base.
  • Analyze support data and communicate actionable insights to product stakeholders and business teams.
  • Serve as liaison between the core team and Hardware Contract Operations team.
  • Provide proactive and reactive support.
  • Develop training materials and online help center documentation.
title: Head of Gamer Support, Stadia
